text: I was snacking on some goldfish crackers recently—you know, the ones made from processed everything.
Fake cheese, fake flour, fake color... which makes perfect sense when you think about it - it's a fake fish! It's not even gold. It's orange.
But you bite into it, and it’s like: ‘Mmm, delicious... wait, is this even food?’
Who cares! Parents throw these things on the ground for their kids to keep them busy for ten minutes.

Meanwhile, my CAT—my CAT—is over there living the high life with gourmet cat food. I dump this can out onto a plate, and I notice this isn’t just fancy kibble; it’s like a seafood buffet. Tuna, salmon, tiny shrimp, and—wait, are those PEAS in there?
Why are there peas in there?
Why are there PEAS in my cat's cat food?
What’s going to happen here? Cat's gonna be like—'Oh, num, num, num. Oh, these peas are so delicious.'
I can’t let him outside where the garden is. He’s gonna be running through it. 'Oh my gosh, there’s a pea pod out here.'
I must have died and gone to kitty heaven. Oh wait—what’s over there? Is that broccoli? Num num num num num. So delicious.
I'm passing by the catnip. I'm not even going to eat a big pile of grass so I can go back inside and throw it up on the carpet. I'm heading right over to the vegetarian section.
No, that didn’t happen. The cat eats around the peas. He’s not dumb. He’s eating all the shrimp. He’s eating all the tuna, the salmon—what’s left behind is a big old pile of peas.
And of course, in our day and age, we can’t waste anything because that would be bad.
We don’t want to throw away food. It’s bad for the environment.
So, I eat them. I know, that’s how I get my veggies. They’re not bad.
I mean, they take the slight flavor of shrimp because they’ve been in a can with shrimp for so long.
But if I’m already eating fake cheese fish, I might as well have some shrimpy peas and convince myself I’m eating healthy.
I’m over here with a box of bottom-shelf snacks and leftovers...
and my cat’s basically eating a $25 sushi roll.
Who’s winning this game?
